synthesis.output: Reorganized the agent package structure by migrating resources into a new `agent/` parent directory, including `skills/`, `tools/`, `plugins/`, and `hooks/`. Successfully moved all files and removed the old empty directories. All tasks were completed and verified with no issues encountered.

Updated `packages/cli/src/commands/install.ts` to modernize all path constants to the `agent/` subdirectory and implemented a new `commands` subcommand. This feature includes help, listing, and installation functionality for command files, complete with support for `--clean` and `--dry-run` flags. The changes were verified for type safety, and no issues were encountered.

Reorganized the `agent/` directory structure by migrating existing skills, tools, plugins, and hooks into a unified hierarchy and verified the migration. The initial stage of the "Agent Package Reorganization" is complete, with subsequent tasks for updating install paths and implementing new opencode commands pending. All migrated files were successfully validated in their new locations.

Implemented six core status commands in the `agent/commands/` directory: `w:status.md`, `w:current.md`, `w:context.md`, `w:list.md`, `w:tree.md`, and `w:preview.md`. Each command file was created with appropriate frontmatter and instructions to execute its corresponding `work` CLI command. All tasks in the "Core Status Commands" thread were completed successfully.

Created `agent/commands/w:agents.md` and `agent/commands/w:prompt.md` to wrap the `work agents` and `work prompt` CLI commands for use within OpenCode sessions. Both commands follow the established YAML frontmatter pattern and support positional arguments where necessary. All tasks for the Agent & Prompt Commands thread are complete.

Created four approval-related command files in `agent/commands/`: `w:approve-plan.md`, `w:approve-tasks.md`, `w:approve-revision.md`, and `w:start.md`. These files provide structured instructions for approving plans, tasks, revisions, and starting workstreams using the `work` command. All tasks in the batch were completed successfully.

Created three new command files in `agent/commands/`: `w:update.md`, `w:read.md`, and `w:complete.md`. These files enable the task-implementer agent to update task status, read task details, and mark workstreams as complete using the `work` CLI. All tasks for batch 02.03 were marked as completed and GitHub issue #60 was closed.

Updated `README.md` to include the `agent/` directory and documentation for the new `ag install commands` installation flags. Created `docs/opencode-commands.md` as a comprehensive reference guide for the `w:` command prefix and its mapping to the `work` CLI, including common usage examples.

Fixed a bug in `packages/cli/src/commands/install.ts` that excluded markdown-based commands from being listed or installed. Verified the fix by successfully listing and installing `opencode` commands, confirming their functionality through `w:status` and `w:approve-plan`.

Removed the `agent/commands/` directory and updated documentation across `docs/opencode-commands.md`, `README.md`, and multiple skill files (`planning-workstreams`, `implementing-workstreams`, `reviewing-workstreams`) to reflect the new `!work` bash syntax for user commands. The distinction between user-facing commands (with `!`) and agent commands (without `!`) is now clearly documented, and all 53 tasks in the workstream are marked as 100% complete.
